Articles.Content:
I'm going to be circumnavigating the lonely space potato, Dres.

Why? Because I don't see anyone else that's done it.

This is the rover that's going to be making the trip, the Potato 2.

![QYsYjiA.png](http://i.imgur.com/QYsYjiA.png)

It's powered by RTGs and solar panels. It has an LV-909 "Terrier" engine at the back for 'extra speed' ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Ep 1 - Getting to Dres

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/4LyhP)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-16T20:15:59Z" title="08/16/2015 08:15  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 16, 2015</time> by TheCatMan17**
  
Minor fixes

Sorry for my absence, I had things to do with my life.

Ep 2 - Journey to Checkpoint 1

The journey was quite difficult, and I had to make quite a few repairs (to the wheels), but I got there and that's all that matters.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/Ki0m7)

Followed you here from the Eve thread--nice work on the Potato, and welcome to the Forum!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-16T19:12:45Z" title="08/16/2015 07:12  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 16, 2015</time> by Kuzzter**
Also followed you fro Kuzzters thread, good luck, always love to see Dres getting some love!

Good luck, CatMan. Dres has a tendency to eat rover wheels for some reason, as you're finding out.

Dres also has a massive canyon running N-S somehwere. I've always wanted to try jumping it with a rover ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

Jumping over? Only if you want to continue on foot. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Driving through the canyon is a much better idea.

I do have to express my concern over the validity of this mission.

It's a known fact that nobody has ever been there.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/5GXFzMnCWBs?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

> 
> Jumping over? Only if you want to continue on foot. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> Driving through the canyon is a much better idea.

I'll probably do both! I also have an engine on the back of my rover to help boost me across it.

> 
> Jumping over? Only if you want to continue on foot. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> Driving through the canyon is a much better idea.
> 
> I do have to express my concern over the validity of this mission.
> 
> It's a known fact that nobody has ever been there.
> 
> [https://youtu.be/5GXFzMnCWBs](https://youtu.be/5GXFzMnCWBs)

You could have a .99 TWR ship to minimize damage. Or retro thrusters and a .99 TWR and landing legs.

Go on! Do it! I need this to happen! Dres, I love Dres, yet nobody else does! Go on, please! Good luck, Dressie. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Sorry for the delay, had to do things again! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

It seems that today our "brave" pilot Jeb has faced a tragic accident!

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/cZikV)

For reasons unknown (I wiped my game clean of mods) the Dres Circumnavigation has been stopped. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I might start it back again if I have the time, but now isn't that time.
